events.message: The applicant submitted the personal loan application online, indicating the loan is intended to cover unexpected medical expenses.
The loan application was categorized under Personal Loan due to the medical-related keywords provided by the applicant.
Loan officer Sarah Jenkins was assigned to handle the case and reach out to the applicant for further clarifications.
An initial review of the submitted application and initial documents showed qualification criteria may be met, pending verification.
Additional documents related to medical bills and proof of income were requested from the applicant for further processing.
Applicant promptly submitted all requested documents including detailed medical invoices and recent pay stubs.
Credit report returned with a good score and no significant negative marks, supporting the applicant's ability to repay the loan.
Risk assessment completed taking into account the applicant's credit history and recent medical expense, resulting in moderate risk.
A formal loan offer was presented to the applicant with favorable terms tailored to cover medical costs over a 24-month period.
Applicant responded positively to the loan offer and requested slight adjustment of payment dates to align with payday schedule.
Due to minor terms modification requests, the application was escalated to the senior loan committee for final approval.
The loan committee approved the modified terms, confirming the applicant’s ability to manage repayments alongside medical expenses.
Funds were successfully disbursed into the applicant’s designated bank account to cover medical expenses as requested.
A follow-up call was made to the applicant to confirm receipt of funds and provide support for scheduled payments.
The loan application process was closed successfully, with the applicant satisfied and all documents properly archived.
